meanings.definition: To feel a strong aversion or disapproval towards something.
meanings.sent1: I degusted the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent2: She degusted the idea of going to the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The cat degusted the new brand of cat food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The smell of rotten eggs degusted me like nothing else.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the food degusted him to the point of feeling sick.

meanings.definition: To be repulsed or disgusted by something.
meanings.sent1: The spoiled milk degusted me when I accidentally took a sip.
meanings.sent2: He degusted the sight of the creepy crawly spider on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs degusted her, but she had to do it for the dare.
meanings.sent4: The slimy texture of the food degusted him to the point of feeling sick.
meanings.sent5: The foul smell coming from the garbage can degusted everyone in the room.
